title: How to Disable Private Browsing in Safari on iPhone or iPad: Quick Guide

steps.title: Open the Safari app on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Safari app on your iPhone or iPad. It's a blue and red compass on one of your home screen pages. This method turns off private browsing and takes you back to normal browsing. [3] X Research source Private browsing is a great way to avoid cookies. When you switch to normal browsing, you'll need to manually delete cookies in Safari .

steps.title: Tap the tabs icon.
steps.content: Tap the tabs icon. It's two overlapping squares in the bottom right of Safari.

steps.title: Tap Private.
steps.content: Tap Private . It's at the bottom of the tabs page.

steps.title: Tap # Tabs.
steps.content: Tap # Tabs . This will take you back to normal browsing in Safari. Note that any private tabs you have open won't close automatically when switching browsing modes. This will be called Start Page if you don't have any tabs open in the normal browsing mode. Private mode doesn't record your browsing history. For normal browsing mode, you can delete your browsing history if needed.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. It's a gray gear icon on one of your home screen pages. [4] X Research source This method uses the built-in content and privacy restriction features to limit access to adult websites. This setting turns off the ability to use private browsing in Safari. Note that this will also prevent the user from accessing most websites with adult content.

steps.title: Tap Screen Time.
steps.content: Tap Screen Time . It has a purple and white hourglass icon. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Content & Privacy Restrictions.
steps.content: Tap Content & Privacy Restrictions . If you have set up restrictions before, you'll be prompted to enter your Screen Time password. If you haven't, you'll be taken to the restrictions page immediately.

steps.title: Tap the toggle next to "Content & Privacy Restrictions" if needed.
steps.content: Tap the toggle next to "Content & Privacy Restrictions" if needed. If you haven't set up restrictions in the past, you'll need to turn the feature on now. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Limit Adult Websites.
steps.content: Tap Limit Adult Websites . A checkmark will appear next to the option. You're done! There will no longer be a Private option in Safari. Note that this will also prevent you from accessing most websites with adult content.
